name: Ammunition
effect: Many abilities require Ammunition, or a specific item or equipment. These abilities will specify any requirements on the Ammunition (such as an Elemental type or Size) and within what Range it must be. This ability uses said Ammunition to resolve the Attack, placing it unattended in target's _Arena_. To be used as Ammunition, an item must be _Worn_ by a willing Target or unattended.

name: Arena
effect: Arenas are distinct areas on a battlefield that take some significant effort to traverse between and designate different areas of combat. Generally, characters may spend one Movement to move from an Arena to any connected Arenas, entering at the appropriate _Path_ _Position_ if relevant.

name: Attack Roll
effect: When a creature makes an Attack Roll they roll 2d6 and consult the Attack's _Profile_ to determine the effect. On a _Miss_, creatures gain _Momentum_ equal to half of the total cost of the Attack.

name: Bend
effect: Terrain and other effects may special Interacts that list a Bend value; characters can use a Bend effect that matches the element of said Terrain to resolve it.

name: Bonus
effect: When an Attack gains Bonus Damage or Stun, distribute it between targets however you wish.

name: Brawling
effect: When attacking a _Grabbed_ creature, add _Pierce_ 1 and gain a +1 _Bonus_.

name: Charged
effect: This Ability does some sort of Charged effect. If this is an Attack, it may not be used to Defend.

name: Close
effect: Close Range effects may target any valid target within your current _Arena_.

name: Counter
effect: Effects with Counter may not be triggered in response to one with Counter. Additionally, if you qualified for a _Gambit_ when using this effect, you may choose to use an _Offensive_ _Gambit_ on this Counter rather than a normal _Defensive_ _Gambit_.

name: Defend
effect: Different abilities may allow a creature to Defend. When a creature Defends, they roll 2d6, consult the chart associated with the Ability, and determine the result (Miss, Graze, Hit, Crit). They then compare this result to the result of the incoming attack and determine if they rolled lower (a Loss), matched the Attacker (Tie), or exceeded the Attacker (Win).

name: Discount
effect: Reduce the _Momentum_ Cost of the applicable effect by the listed Discount. If this reduces the Cost below 0, you may spend any remainder on Boosts for the applicable attack or simply gain the difference as _Momentum_.

name: Disengage
effect: When a character Disengages you must stop _Occupying_ your current _Terrain_. Additionally, you may choose to remove _Engaged_ (if applicable) and leave your current _Field_ effect (if applicable). If you remove _Engaged_ in this way, create an _Opening_.

name: Embed
effect: When something gets Embedded it counts as an _Worn_ piece of _Equipment_ for the Target. The Target may end Embed with any effect that would allow them to _Wield_ it. If the triggering _Equipment_ has the _Ammunition_ property, do not add any _Load_ to the Target unless all _Ammunition_ is _Embedded_.

name: Efficient
effect: Reactions with this keyword do not count against the 1 Reaction per Trigger limitation.

name: Exhaust
effect: After using any Ability with this keyword, that Ability may not be used for the remainder of the combat.

name: Fleeting
effect: Fleeting Terrains are _Destroyed_ at the end of the current _Round_.

name: Foci
effect: While _Wielding_ this, whenever you you use an effect that allows you to place _Momentum_ on an Art or Technique and you choose an Art or Technique that matches this Foci's type, place an additional _Momentum_ and treat the Hands used to _Wield_ this as Free.

name: Gambit
effect: Gambits are _Maneuvers_ that allow characters to enhance an Attack or Defense. When making an Attack, characters may use a Gambit if they roll doubles or roll a Critical Hit. If Defending, characters may use a Gambit if they roll doubles or Win. Characters may qualify for more than one Gambit on a single roll, such as when they roll doubles and get a Critical Hit. If a Gambit is triggered by an _Area_ Attack resolve the effects against a single Target per Gambit unless specified otherwise.

name: Glancing
effect: A Glancing effect did not hit as solidly as it should have; it deals no _Stun_. The Target gains a +1 to _Negate.

name: Guard
effect: Guard reduces Damage.

name: Kinesis
effect:
Characters with kinesis for an element gain the following benefits when targeting _Equipment_ of that type:
* You may use [_Armament_] Abilities (such as _Draw/Stow_) at the listed Kinesis Range. If they would normally create an [_Opening_], they instead do not.

name: Limited
effect: This ability may only be used once in the listed frequency, typically either _Turn_, _Round_, or _Phase_.

name: Prepare
effect: When you Prepare, place up to the specified amount of _Momentum_ on any _Art_ or _Equipment_, removing it from your supply. This _Momentum_ may be used to pay the cost of any Ability on said _Art_. At _Refresh_ or when _Stunned_, lose half the Prepared resources on all Equipment and Arts. When _Wounded_, lose all Prepared resources on all Equipment and Arts. If you stop _Wielding_ a piece of _Equipment_, lose all Prepared resources.

name: Hand-and-a-Half
effect: This _Equipment_ may be _Wielded_ in one or both Hands.

name: Melee
effect: Melee Attacks may only be used against creatures currently in a _Engagement_ with you.

name: Momentum
effect:
Momentum represents various advantages in combat. It is spent for a myriad of effects, but most commonly increasing the power of abilities using Boosts and paying for _Stunts_.

If a creature would lose Momentum due to an effect but has no Momentum they instead gain 2 _Stun_ for every Momentum they would lose.

Some effects will refer to placing Momentum on a creature or Art. Momentum placed on a creature may be used by their enemies to purchase any effects that target solely that creature, such as _Reactions_ against their Attacks or _Boosts_ on Single-Target Attacks. Momentum placed on an Art may only be used to use said Art.

name: Movement
effect:
Movement is a resource that characters may spend to move about the battlefield. 1 Movement may be spent at any point on your _Turn_ for any of the following effects:
* You may always:
	* _Disengage_.
* If you are not _Engaged_:
	* Enter an adjacent _Arena_, joining the appropriate _Position_.
	* Leave your current _Position_ and enter a new one within the same _Arena_.

Characters may spend any amount of Movement on these effects in a given _Turn_.

name: Opening
effect: When a creature creates an Opening they are doing something that compromises their defenses. Many _Punish_ _Reactions_ allow enemies to _Attack_ when an Opening is created.

name: Parry
effect: A Parry is a riskier version of a _Block_ Reaction; a _Graze_ is instead treated as a _Miss_. However, these effects will typically grant a bonus on a _Hit_+.

name: Pierce
effect: This effect ignores an amount of the Target's _Guard_ equal to its Pierce value.

name: Priority
effect: This Action must be used immediately after a _Phase_ begins and ignores the normal _Initiative_ process.

name: Quickdraw
effect: So long as your have a _Free Hand_ you may always treat this piece of Equipment as _Wielded_ while it is _Worn_.

name: Rank
effect: Rank refers to the result of an Attack or Defense Roll and corresponds to Miss, Graze, Hit, and Crit, in that order. Many effects increase or decrease the Rank, which moves it up or down the chart as applicable. An effect may not go below a Miss or above a Crit.

name: Remote
effect: This Attack does not originate from the attacker; when determining _Cover_, use the Range from the attack's origin and the Target.

name: Pacifist
effect: If you use this Maneuver you may not use any Attacks this _Turn_.

name: Rooted
effect: You may not use _Movement_ this _Turn_.

name: Safe
effect: Any Attacks made as a part of a [_Punish_] _Reaction_ are made at _Disadvantage_ against you this _Turn_.

name: Short
effect: Short Range effects may target any valid target within an adjacent _Arena_.

name: Medium
effect: Medium Range effects may target any valid target in an _Arena_ two away.

name: Long
effect: Long Range effects may target any valid target in an _Arena_ three away.

name: Follow-Up
effect: Attacks with this Keyword typically are triggered by some other effect and may not qualify for _Gambits_.

name: Slow Turn
effect: A Slow _Turn_ happens after all other _Turn_ in a _Phase_. If there are multiple Slow Turns, resolve them in popcorn Initiative as normal.

name: Small
effect: This piece of Equipment may be equipped in a consumables Slot. If it is, it costs no _Load_.

name: Soak
effect: Reduce any _Stun_ inflicted by a character's _Soak_ value.

name: Padding
effect: Padding is effectively an extension to a character's _Stun_ meter, typically granted by equipment. Whenever a character takes _Stun_ it first is applied to their _Padding_ until their Padding meter is full. If a character's Padding is reduced any current Padding above the new limit is immediately applied to _Stun_. In all other ways (such as removing _Stun_) Padding behaves identically.

name: Stun
effect: Stun is a special status that creatures accumulate through combat. When a creature reaches their maximum Stun value any additional Stun inflicted is converted to Damage.

name: Summon
effect:
When a spirit is Summoned they take physical form until _Defeated_ or _Recalled_, and use the following rules:
* Spirits have their own Health, Stun, and Movement, and gain their own Status effects.
* Spirits and their companion share _Momentum_.
* Spirits act at their listed _Speed_ during the players' phase.

name: Turn
effect:
Once per _Phase_ a character may choose to take their Turn. When a character takes their Turn, they do one of the following:
* If this _Phase_ is when a character chose to use their _Technique_, they resolve that effect.
* If this is any other _Phase_, a character may instead use any _Attack_ or _Action_ granted by an _Art_.

Additionally, on their Turn, characters may use any number of _Enhancement_ effects as well as expend any amount of _Movement_.

name: Technique
effect: Techniques are how creatures interact in combat. These are what allow creatures to attack, influence the environment, and gain the resources to dodge and block attacks. A Technique must be selected while _Plotting_, at which point it is assigned a _Phase_. A creature may not use that Technique until that _Phase_.

name: Temporary
effect: Temporary bonuses and resources are are lost at the end of the current _Phase_. Temporary bonuses do not count against any caps that a character might have.

name: Thrown
effect: After using an effect with this Range, place this _Equipment_ at the Target's _Position_.

name: Occupy
effect: While a creature is Occupying Terrain they gain the listed effects of said Terrain. A number of creatures may Occupy a Terrain equal to its Size. If a Terrain is Forcibly Moved, all creatures Occupying it stop Occupying.

name: Recover
effect: When a creature Recovers they may remove one of their Statuses, as outlined by its Recover text.

name: Wear
effect: Wear represents the typical wear and tear on equipment. Most equipment will have a Wear value; when prompted for a Wear roll, you roll 2d6. If you roll the item's Wear value or lower, decrease the equipment's _Durability_ by 1.
